sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import ToggleButtonGroup from 'react-bootstrap/ToggleButtonGroup'; import ToggleButton from 'react-bootstrap/ToggleButton'; import DropdownButton from 'react-bootstrap/DropdownButton' import Dropdown from 'react-bootstrap/Dropdown' class Buttons extends Component { constructor(){ super() this.state = { Gender: 1, Orientation: 1, Meeting: null, Name: "", Education: null, School: null, Occupation: null } this.handleText=this.handleText.bind(this) this.handleButton=this.handleButton.bind(this) this.handleDropdown=this.handleDropdown.bind(this) } handleText(event) { const {Name, value2}= event.currentTarget this.setState({[Name]: value2}) } handleGender(event) { const {Gender, value}= event.currentTarget this.setState({[Gender]: value}) } handleOrientation(event) { const {Orientation, value} = event.currentTarget this.setState({[Orientation]: value}) } handleMeeting(event) { const{Meeting, value}= event.currentTarget this.setState({[Meeting]: value}) } handleEducation(event) { const{Education, value}= event.currentTarget this.setState({[Education]: value}) } handleDropdown(event) { const {eventKey, value}= event.currentTarget this.setState({[eventKey]: value}) } output(event){ event.preventDefault() console.log(this.state.Gender) console.log(this.state.Orientation) console.log(this.state.Meeting) console.log(this.state.Name) console.log(this.state.Education) console.log(this.state.School) console.log(this.state.Occupation) } render(){ return(
Man Woman

Hetrosexual Bisexual

Hetrosexual Woman Bisexual Woman Both


High School Bachelor Master Doctorate PG Diploma

Dropdown item text School 1 School 2 School 3

Dropdown item text Pro 1 Pro 2 Pro 3

) } } export default Buttons
